name: Biology HL
description: IB Biology explores living organisms at multiple levels from molecules to ecosystems. HL students study additional depth in molecular biology, biochemistry, plant biology, genetics, and animal physiology.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 1
assessmentComponents.description: Multiple choice questions on core and AHL material
assessmentComponents.structure: 40 multiple choice questions covering all topics. No calculator allowed. Questions test knowledge, comprehension, and application.

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 2
assessmentComponents.description: Data-based questions, short answer questions, and extended response
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A: One data-based question and several short-answer questions (all compulsory, 40 marks). Section B: Extended response - choose 2 from 3 questions (2 x 15 marks). Section C: Extended response - choose 1 from 2 questions (20 marks).
markingCriteria: Data-based: analyze and interpret unfamiliar data
Short answer: demonstrate knowledge and application
Extended response: construct coherent arguments with evidence

assessmentComponents.name: Paper 3
assessmentComponents.description: Section A: Data-based and short-answer on experimental work. Section B: Short-answer and extended response on ONE Option
assessmentComponents.structure: Section A (all compulsory, 35 marks): Questions on core practical skills and scientific methodology. Section B (choose one option, ~25 marks): Extended questions on chosen Option topic.
markingCriteria: Section A tests practical skills and scientific thinking
Section B requires in-depth knowledge of Option

assessmentComponents.name: Internal Assessment
assessmentComponents.description: Individual investigation - a scientific report (6-12 pages) on a topic of student's choice
assessmentComponents.structure: Personal engagement (8%), Exploration (25%), Analysis (25%), Evaluation (25%), Communication (17%). Total 24 marks.
markingCriteria: Personal engagement: genuine interest, independent thinking
Exploration: clear focus, relevant and sufficient methodology
Analysis: appropriate analysis with uncertainties and errors
Evaluation: critical evaluation of methodology and results

assessmentObjectives.description: Knowledge and understanding of facts, concepts, terminology, methodologies, techniques and procedures
Application and analysis of knowledge and understanding to new and familiar situations
Synthesis and evaluation of knowledge and evidence to construct arguments, draw conclusions and make judgments

practicalRequirements: Students must complete a minimum of 40 hours of practical work (HL), including hands-on laboratory activities, use of databases, simulations, and fieldwork. The practical scheme of work should cover a range of techniques and promote development of experimental skills.
iaGuidelines: The Individual Investigation (IA) is a student-designed scientific investigation worth 20% of the final grade. Students should select a topic that allows for personal engagement and original research. The investigation should demonstrate understanding of the scientific method, proper data analysis with uncertainties, and critical evaluation of methodology and results.
